column4: just started up UFW, and trying to block an ip. ufw status http://pastebin.com/89P1bsq4
68.237.205.4 can still connect to my server
and someone told me they use 'block ip reason'?
like typing 'block <ip> <reason>' into the command line
and lets say i want to delete that rule...
and at first i thought that was an insult, but apt-get tells me its not
That will ban host after number of failed attempts, neat way to reduce junk-traffic.
even better, change ssh listening port.
ok, cool, but thats not what im worried about
im curious how i would remove the rule 'iptables -A INPUT -s 68.237.205.4 -p tcp -j DROP'
